intro: Amellus asper var. normalis, commonly known as the rough amellus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
